meanings.definition: In a habitual or customary manner.
meanings.sent1: She wontedly brushed her teeth before bed every night.
meanings.sent2: He always wore his favorite hat wontedly when going out.
meanings.sent3: The cat wontedly knocked over the same vase every morning, like clockwork.
meanings.sent4: His laughter filled the room wontedly, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The old clock chimed wontedly, marking the passage of time.

meanings.definition: In a way that is accustomed or usual.
meanings.sent1: The children wontedly played in the park after school.
meanings.sent2: The birds chirped wontedly in the early morning hours.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail wontedly upon seeing its owner return.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed wontedly in the spring, painting the fields with color.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed wontedly against the shore, a familiar sound to the fisherman.
